# Draft:The Alliance Against State Hostage Taking

The Alliance Against State Hostage Taking was a collective initiative founded by a group of few former hostages and families of detainees to campaign against a new wave of Iran's hostage diplomacy. The Islamic Republic of Iran since the negotiations and aftermath of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), has employed a fresh trend of the tactic of arresting Western nationals in a bid to extract concessions from its foes, in a strategy of Hostage diplomacythat has long presented Western world with a dilemma
The movement, which was also primarily known as the Families Alliance Against State-Hostage Taking argued that Iran was systematically arresting dual nationals, often with Western ties, on false, unfounded charges like espionage or "collaborating with hostile states", using their imprisonment as leverage to extract political and economic concessions from Western governments.
It formally launched at the United Nations General Assembly in New York on September 24, 2019.
The Alliance Against State Hostage Taking established a powerful sosial movement, serving as the foundational inspiration for several subsequent human rights groups and
charitable organizations. Among its most notable offspring are Hostage International, Hostage Aid Worldwide and Hostagesses Alliance, all dedicated advance the original movement's mission of eliminating the use of arbitrary detention of foreign individuals to exert pressure on other governments, extract concessions, or influence negotiationsâ€”particularly in relation to political disputes and geopolitical disagreements.
All those organisations have been actively involved in addressing the ongoing cases of the kidnapped US journalist Austin Tice, and the British couple  Craig and Lindsay Foreman who were arrested in Tehran in January 2025 on charges of espionage. and also
in advocacy efforts following the kidnapping of 240 Israeli citizens by Hamas militants during the  7th October 2023 attacks.
